newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: EU insists on conditions for ties with Yugoslavia.
newsitem.headline: EU insists on conditions for ties with Yugoslavia.

text.p: An official for the European Commission insisted on Friday that rump Yugoslavia must comply with tough conditions, including maintaining pressure on Bosnian Serbs for peace in Bosnia, before ties with the EU are restored.

Michael Graham, European Commission charge d'affairs in Belgrade, said Yugoslavia had to help implement the Dayton accord, ensure a transition to democracy and political and economic reforms, and respect human and ethnic rights.
The West wants Yugoslavia -- comprising Serbia and Montenegro -- to put pressure on the Bosnian Serbs to toe the line in complying with the Dayton peace agreement which ended the Bosnian war.

Addressing the same round-table meeting on Yugoslavia's relations with the EU, Predrag Simic who heads the Institute of International Politics and Economics, reaffirmed Yugoslavia's "clear political aim" of participating in European integration.
He said the European Commission particularly insisted on regional cooperation with former Yugoslavia's republics.
Graham's mention of human and ethnic rights was a clear allusion to the situation in Serbia's troubled Kosovo province where ethnic Albanians outnumber the Serbs 9-1.

To get rid of an outer ring of U.N.-sanctions denying it access to the world capital markets, Belgrade must improve its spotty human rights record in Kosovo where it cracked down on Albanians in 1989 claiming they want to secede.
